opord.title: OPORD Integration Guidance
opord.targetingText: The following vulnerabilities are prioritized for engagement based on composite scoring:
opord.tasksText: Units should plan operations to exploit identified vulnerabilities in priority order.
opord.coordinatingText: Continuous assessment of COG vulnerabilities required throughout operation.
opord.annexDText: Targeting matrix included as attachment to Fires Annex.

simulation.title: What If? Simulation Mode
simulation.instructions: Click nodes to remove and see cascade effects

tooltips.dragToPan: Drag to pan, scroll to zoom

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.description: Title and description for your COG analysis

operationalContext.title: Operational Context
operationalContext.description: Answer guided questions to define your operational environment
operationalContext.objectivePlaceholder: Example: Identify and prioritize adversary information operations vulnerabilities to enable IO counter-campaign and degrade their ability to influence regional populations
operationalContext.impactLabel: What impact do we want to achieve?
operationalContext.impactPlaceholder: Example: Reduce adversary IO effectiveness by 60%, forcing them to shift resources from offensive to defensive operations, creating windows for friendly information advantage
operationalContext.identityPlaceholder: Example: Joint Task Force with cyber, information operations, and special operations capabilities; partnered with host nation security forces and regional allies
operationalContext.environmentPlaceholder: Example: Urban environment with high internet penetration (70%+), contested information space with multiple state/non-state actors, weak governance creating information voids, population increasingly mobile-first for news consumption
operationalContext.constraintsPlaceholder: Example: Must obtain interagency approval, Limited to non-attribution operations, Resource cap of 50 personnel
operationalContext.restraintsPlaceholder: Example: No targeting of civilian infrastructure, Prohibited from cross-border operations, Cannot disrupt international commerce

objective.title: A good objective is specific, measurable, and tied to commander's intent.
objective.example2: Protect friendly COGs from adversary action

impact.title: Describe the desired end-state or effect.

identity.title: Describe friendly force composition and capabilities.
identity.include: Include: organizational structure, key capabilities, partnered forces, unique advantages

environment.title: Describe the operational environment using PMESII-PT:

constraints.title: Constraints are things you MUST do or CONDITIONS that limit action.
constraints.example2: Limited to defensive cyber operations only
constraints.example4: Requires host nation approval for any kinetic action

restraints.title: Restraints are things you MUST NOT do or PROHIBITED actions.
restraints.example2: No engagement of state media infrastructure

tooltips.timeframe: Specify the planning horizon or operational window. This helps prioritize vulnerabilities based on when effects are needed.

cogDescription.title: A COG is a source of power that provides moral or physical strength, freedom of action, or will to act.

cogRationale.title: Explain what makes this a true COG:
cogRationale.point1: What happens if this is neutralized?
cogRationale.point3: How does this enable the actor's objectives?

capabilities.title: Capabilities are ACTIONS (verbs) the COG can perform.

requirements.title: Requirements are RESOURCES/CONDITIONS (nouns) the capability needs to function.

vulnerabilities.title: Vulnerabilities are deficiencies or weaknesses in a requirement that can be exploited.

tooltips.impactScoring: How significantly would this affect the COG?
tooltips.followUpScoring: What strategic advantages does this enable?

cog.title: Centers of Gravity
cog.description: Identify COGs across DIMEFIL domains for each actor
cog.emptyState: No COGs defined. Click "Add COG" to begin.
cog.descriptionLabel: What is this Center of Gravity? *
cog.descriptionPlaceholder: Example: Adversary's integrated air defense system provides freedom of maneuver and protects critical infrastructure across the theater
cog.rationalePlaceholder: Example: Without air defense, adversary loses sanctuary for ground forces, logistics hubs, and C2 nodes. Historical analysis shows air dominance correlates with 85% success rate in similar conflicts.
cog.validationCheck1: If neutralized, would this critically degrade objectives?
cog.validationCheck2: Is this truly a source of power (not just important)?
cog.validationCheck3: Is this at the right level of analysis?
cog.validationCheck4: Can this be protected/exploited through its vulnerabilities?

capabilities.title: Critical Capabilities - What can the COG DO?
capabilities.capabilityPlaceholder: Example: Launch coordinated missile strikes OR Influence public perception through social media
capabilities.howItWorksPlaceholder: Example: Uses network of bot accounts, influencers, and state media to amplify narratives across platforms within 24-48 hours
capabilities.strategicContributionLabel: How does this support the actor's objectives?
capabilities.strategicContributionPlaceholder: Example: Enables shaping of regional opinion to support strategic objectives, undermine adversaries, and prepare information environment for military operations

requirements.title: Critical Requirements - What does this capability NEED?
requirements.requirementPlaceholder: Example: Platform policy compliance OR Network of coordinated accounts
requirements.descriptionLabel: What is this requirement and why is it needed?
requirements.descriptionPlaceholder: Example: Requires active accounts on major platforms to distribute content. Must maintain compliance with platform terms of service to avoid account suspension or content removal.

vulnerabilities.title: Critical Vulnerabilities - What is the WEAKNESS?
vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityPlaceholder: Example: Platform policy enforcement OR Single command node
vulnerabilities.descriptionLabel: What is this vulnerability and how can it be exploited?
vulnerabilities.descriptionPlaceholder: Example: Platforms enforce content policies against coordinated inauthentic behavior. Mass reporting campaigns can trigger automated suspensions within 24-48 hours, disrupting the entire influence operation.
vulnerabilities.expectedEffectPlaceholder: Example: Adversary loses primary influence mechanism within 48 hours.
vulnerabilities.recommendedActionsPlaceholder: Report accounts, Work with platforms, Monitor adaptation

scoring.title: Scoring System
scoring.description: Select scoring method and configure criteria for vulnerability assessment
scoring.impactCriterion: Impact on COG (I): How significantly would this affect the COG?
scoring.attainabilityCriterion: Attainability (A): How feasible is addressing this?
scoring.followUpCriterion: Follow-up Potential (F): What strategic advantages does this enable?
scoring.criterionDefinitionPlaceholder: How would you define this criterion?
scoring.customCompositeNote: Note: Composite Score = Sum of all criteria scores (1-5 scale per criterion)

validation.titleRequired: Please enter a title for your COG analysis
validation.saveFailed: Failed to save COG analysis. Please try again.

confirmations.removeCOG: Remove this COG and all dependent items?
confirmations.removeCapability: Remove this capability and all dependent items?
confirmations.removeRequirement: Remove this requirement and all dependent vulnerabilities?

dialog.title: Quick-Score Mode
dialog.description: Rapidly score all vulnerabilities using presets or custom values. Sorted by composite score in real-time.
dialog.customSystemNotSupported: Quick-Score mode is currently only available for linear and logarithmic scoring systems. Please use the advanced form for custom scoring criteria.

vulnerabilityMatrix.title: Vulnerability Comparison Matrix
vulnerabilityMatrix.description: Compare and prioritize vulnerabilities across all Centers of Gravity
vulnerabilityMatrix.emptyState: No vulnerabilities match the current filters

suggestCog.title: AI COG Suggestions
suggestCog.description: AI will suggest potential Centers of Gravity based on your operational context

validateCog.title: AI COG Validation
validateCog.description: AI will validate your COG against JP 3-0 doctrine criteria

generateCapabilities.title: AI Capability Suggestions
generateCapabilities.description: AI will suggest critical capabilities for this COG

generateRequirements.title: AI Requirements Suggestions
generateRequirements.description: AI will suggest critical requirements for this capability

generateVulnerabilities.title: AI Vulnerability Suggestions
generateVulnerabilities.description: AI will suggest critical vulnerabilities for this requirement

generateImpact.title: AI Impact Analysis
generateImpact.description: AI will analyze the impact of exploiting this vulnerability

errors.cogRequiredForCapabilities: COG data required for capability generation
errors.capabilityRequired: Capability data required for requirements generation
errors.requirementRequired: Requirement data required for vulnerability generation

noResults.title: No Results
noResults.description: AI did not return any suggestions. Please try again.

acceptToast.title: AI Suggestion Accepted
acceptToast.description: The AI-generated content has been applied.

vulnerabilitiesTab.title: Critical Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilitiesTab.description: Ranked by composite score (Impact + Attainability + Follow-up)

alerts.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{{title}}"?

dialog.title: Start New COG Analysis
dialog.description: Choose how to create your analysis: guided wizard or advanced mode. You can also start from a template or blank.
dialog.blankDescription: Start from scratch with an empty COG analysis framework

adversaryC2.name: Adversary Command & Control
adversaryC2.description: Template for analyzing adversary command and control structures and identifying vulnerabilities in military decision-making processes

adversaryInfoOps.name: Adversary Information Operations
adversaryInfoOps.description: Template for analyzing adversary information warfare capabilities and identifying weaknesses in propaganda and influence networks

friendlyLogistics.name: Friendly Logistics COG
friendlyLogistics.description: Template for analyzing friendly forces logistics to identify and protect critical vulnerabilities in supply chains

cyberDomain.name: Cyber Domain COG
cyberDomain.description: Template for analyzing adversary cyber capabilities and critical infrastructure dependencies

hostNationInfrastructure.name: Host Nation Critical Infrastructure
hostNationInfrastructure.description: Template for analyzing host nation critical infrastructure to identify protection priorities during operations

navigation.switchToAdvanced: Switch to advanced mode? Your current progress will be transferred to the advanced form.

step1.alert: Set the operational context for your analysis. This frames the entire COG assessment.
step1.objectivePlaceholder: Identify and prioritize adversary command and control vulnerabilities...
step1.impactLabel: What impact do we want to achieve?
step1.impactRequired: 💥 What impact do we want to achieve? *
step1.impactPlaceholder: Disrupt adversary ability to coordinate forces...
step1.identityPlaceholder: Joint Task Force with multi-domain capabilities
step1.timeframePlaceholder: 30-45 days from assessment to decision point

step2.alert: Identify the primary Center of Gravity. A COG is a source of power that provides moral or physical strength, freedom of action, or will to act.
step2.descriptionLabel: What is this Center of Gravity?
step2.descriptionRequired: 📝 What is this Center of Gravity? *
step2.descriptionPlaceholder: Integrated Command and Control System enabling synchronized multi-domain operations
step2.rationalePlaceholder: Without this C2 system, adversary cannot coordinate air, ground, and naval forces effectively...

validationChecks.criticallyDegrades: If neutralized, would this critically degrade the actor's ability to achieve objectives?
validationChecks.sourceOfPower: Is this truly a source of power (not just important)?
validationChecks.rightLevel: Is this at the right level of analysis?
validationChecks.canBeExploited: Can this be protected/exploited through its critical requirements and vulnerabilities?

step2.validationWarning: Complete the validation checklist to ensure this is a valid COG. You can proceed but validation is recommended.

step3.alert: Map critical capabilities - what can the COG DO? Use action verbs (coordinate, project, influence, etc.)
step3.validationError: Please complete at least one capability with both the capability name and description before proceeding.

step4.alert: Identify critical requirements - what does the COG NEED? Focus on resources, conditions, or infrastructure.

step5.alert: Assess critical vulnerabilities - what are the WEAKNESSES? Identify specific exploitable aspects of requirements.
step5.vulnerabilityPlaceholder: e.g., Single point of failure in communication hub
step5.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the vulnerability and how it could be exploited...
step5.expectedEffectPlaceholder: Adversary loses primary C2 capability within 48 hours...
step5.recommendedActionsPlaceholder: Conduct detailed target analysis, Develop strike options, Coordinate with cyber command
step5.requirementLinkRequired: 🔗 Exploits Which Requirements? * (Select at least one)
step5.requirementLinkWarning: ⚠️ Must select at least one requirement
step5.noRequirementsWarning: No requirements defined yet. Go back to Step 4 to add requirements.

step6.alert: Review your COG analysis before saving. You can edit details later in advanced mode.
step6.advancedModeNote: After saving, you can refine scoring, add additional COGs, and link evidence in advanced mode.

validation.requiredFields: Please fill in all required fields before proceeding.
validation.atLeastOneCapability: Please add at least one capability.
validation.atLeastOneRequirement: Please add at least one requirement.
validation.atLeastOneVulnerability: Please add at least one vulnerability.
validation.cogValidationIncomplete: Complete the validation checklist to ensure this is a valid COG.

dialog.description: Choose how to create your analysis: guided wizard or advanced mode. You can also start from a template or blank.
